pull.title: test: Add coverage for dumptxoutset failure robustness
pull.body:
This adds a test that checks that network activity is not suspended if dumptxoutset fails in the middle of its process which is implemented with the `NetworkDisable` RAII class. I would have liked to add coverage for the `TemporaryRollback` RAII class but that seems a lot more tricky since the failure needs to happen at some point after the rollback and on the scale of our test chain here I couldn't find a way to do it yet. This was requested by pablomartin4btc here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30808#pullrequestreview-2280450117. To test the test you can comment out the content of the destructor of `NetworkDisable`.

It also addresses the feedback by ryanofsky to use `std::optional` instead of `std::unique_ptr` for the management of the RAII object: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30808#discussion_r1744149228

<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [pablomartin4btc](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30817#pullrequestreview-2283624689) |
| Approach ACK | [tdb3](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30817#pullrequestreview-2281665391) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with 👎 to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.

Approach ACK

Nice addition.  Definitely don't want network broken from a failed RPC.
Keeping the PR scoped to just `NetworkDisable` seems good (more concise to reviewers).

author Fabian Jahr <fjahr@protonmail.com> 1725467395 +0200
committer Fabian Jahr <fjahr@protonmail.com> 1725525034 +0200

test: Add coverage for failing dumptxoutset behavior

In case of a failure to create the dump, the node should not be left in an inconsistent state like deactivated network activity or an invalidated blockchain.

test: Add coverage for failing dumptxoutset behavior

In case of a failure to create the dump, the node should not be left in an inconsistent state like deactivated network activity or an invalidated blockchain.

events.message:
refactor: Manage dumptxoutset RAII classes with std::optional

Also removes unused UniValue error variable.

events.body:
> You can also remove UniValue error

Done in the refactoring commit, thanks!

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -60,6 +62,16 @@ def run_test(self):
         assert_raises_rpc_error(
             -8, 'Invalid snapshot type "bogus" specified. Please specify "rollback" or "latest"', node.dumptxoutset, 'utxos.dat', "bogus")
 
+        self.log.info(f"Test that dumptxoutset failure does not leave the network activity suspended")
+        rev_file = node.chain_path / "blocks" / "rev00000.dat"
+        bogus_file = node.chain_path / "blocks" / "bogus.dat"
comments.body: Could use `node.blocks_path` instead of `node.chain_path` for these two lines.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -60,6 +62,16 @@ def run_test(self):
         assert_raises_rpc_error(
             -8, 'Invalid snapshot type "bogus" specified. Please specify "rollback" or "latest"', node.dumptxoutset, 'utxos.dat', "bogus")
 
+        self.log.info(f"Test that dumptxoutset failure does not leave the network activity suspended")
+        rev_file = node.chain_path / "blocks" / "rev00000.dat"
+        bogus_file = node.chain_path / "blocks" / "bogus.dat"
+        os.rename(rev_file, bogus_file)
comments.body: style nit: Pathlib should have the corresponding call as a member method. Using that would avoid the `os` import.
